Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Zend_Gdata  
Gapps  
No 
No 

Description

Represents the apps:login element used by the Apps data API. This class is used to describe properties of a user, and is usually contained within instances of Zene_Gdata_Gapps_UserEntry or any other class which is linked to a particular username.

Methods

__construct, __toString, getAdmin, getAgreedToTerms, getChangePasswordAtNextLogin, getDOM, getHashFunctionName, getPassword, getSuspended, getUsername, setAdmin, setAgreedToTerms, setChangePasswordAtNextLogin, setHashFunctionName, setPassword, setSuspended, setUsername, takeAttributeFromDOM,

__construct( string   $username = null, string   $password = null, string   $hashFunctionName = null, boolean   $admin = null, boolean   $suspended = null, boolean   $changePasswordAtNextLogin = null, boolean   $agreedToTerms = null, ) : n/a

Description

Constructs a new Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login object.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$username string | (optional) The username to be used for this login. null
$password string | (optional) The password to be used for this login. null
$hashFunctionName string | (optional) The name of the hash function used to protect the password, or null if no has function has been applied. As of this writing, the only valid values are 'SHA-1' or null. null
$admin boolean | (optional) Whether the user is an administrator or not. null
$suspended boolean | (optional) Whether this login is suspended or not. null
$changePasswordAtNextLogin boolean | (optional) Whether the user is required to change their password at their next login. null
$agreedToTerms boolean | (optional) Whether the user has agreed to the terms of service. null

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Description

Magic toString method allows using this directly via echo Works best in PHP >= 4.2.0

getDOM( DOMDocument   $doc = null,   $majorVersion = 1,   $minorVersion = null, ) : DOMElement

Description

Retrieves a DOMElement which corresponds to this element and all child properties. This is used to build an entry back into a DOM and eventually XML text for sending to the server upon updates, or for application storage/persistence.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$doc DOMDocument | The DOMDocument used to construct DOMElements null
$majorVersion n/a 1
$minorVersion n/a null

Return value

Type Description
DOMElement The DOMElement representing this element and all child properties.

setChangePasswordAtNextLogin( boolean   $value, ) : Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Description

Set the value for this element's changePasswordAtNextLogin attribute.

If true, the user will be forced to set a new password the next time they login.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value boolean | The desired value for this attribute.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login Provides a fluent interface.

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_InvalidArgumentException

setHashFunctionName( string   $value, ) : Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Description

Set the value for this element's hashFunctionName attribute. This indicates whether the password supplied with setPassword() is in plaintext or has had a hash function applied to it. If null, plaintext is assumed. As of this writing, the only valid hash function is 'SHA-1'.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value string | The desired value for this attribute.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login Provides a fluent interface.

setPassword( string   $value, ) : Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Description

Set the value for this element's password attribute. As of this writing, this can be either be provided as plaintext or hashed using the SHA-1 algorithm for protection. If using a hash function, this must be indicated by calling setHashFunctionName().

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value string | The desired value for this attribute.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login Provides a fluent interface.

setSuspended( boolean   $value, ) : Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Description

Set the value for this element's suspended attribute. If true, the user will not be able to login to this domain until unsuspended.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value boolean | The desired value for this attribute.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login Provides a fluent interface.

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Gdata_App_InvalidArgumentException

setUsername( string   $value, ) : Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login

Description

Set the value for this element's username attribute. This string is used to uniquely identify the user in this domian and is used to form this user's email address.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$value string | The desired value for this attribute.

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Gdata_Gapps_Extension_Login Provides a fluent interface.

takeAttributeFromDOM( DOMNode   $attribute, ) : n/a

Description

Given a DOMNode representing an attribute, tries to map the data into instance members. If no mapping is defined, the name and value are stored in an array.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$attribute DOMNode | The DOMNode attribute needed to be handled

Return value

Properties

$_admin, $_agreedToTerms, $_changePasswordAtNextLogin, $_hashFunctionName, $_password, $_rootElement, $_rootNamespace, $_suspended, $_username,

  protected  $_admin = null

True if the user has administrative rights for this domain, false otherwise.boolean


  protected  $_agreedToTerms = null

True if the user has agreed to the terms of service for Google Apps, false otherwise.boolean.


  protected  $_changePasswordAtNextLogin = null

True if the user will be required to change their password at their next login, false otherwise.boolean


  protected  $_hashFunctionName = null

Specifies whether the password stored in _password is in cleartext or is an SHA-1 digest of a password. If the password is cleartext, then this should be null. If the password is an SHA-1 digest, then this should be set to 'SHA-1'.string
<p>At the time of writing, no other hash functions are supported</p>

  protected  $_password = null

The password for the user. May be in cleartext or as an SHA-1 digest, depending on the value of _hashFunctionName.string


  protected  $_rootElement = login


  protected  $_rootNamespace = apps


  protected  $_suspended = null

True if this user has been suspended, false otherwise.boolean


  protected  $_username = null

The username for this user. This is used as the user's email address and when logging in to Google Apps-hosted services.string
